description: From German Tetrodotoxin, corresponding to Tetrodon (tetr- +â€Ž -ode) + toxin.

entries.meaning: (neurotoxicology) A neurotoxin, originally discovered in Tetraodontiformes, and found in pufferfish, blue-ringed octopus, etc.
examples: Both creatures belong to a large pan-tropical order of fish, many of which have tetrodotoxin in their skin, liver, ovaries, and intestines.
